# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.offline as py
import plotly.graph_objs as go
import plotly.offline as py
import plotly.express as px

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

##Code by Taha07  https://www.kaggle.com/taha07/data-scientists-jobs-analysis-visualization/notebook

from wordcloud import WordCloud
from wordcloud import STOPWORDS
stopwords = set(STOPWORDS)
wordcloud = WordCloud(background_color = 'black',
                      height =2000,
                      width = 2000
                     ).generate(str(df["Sub-Indicator"]))
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12,12)
plt.axis("off")
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.title("Nepal Children Population Sub_indicator")
plt.show()

# categorical features with missing values
categorical_nan = [feature for feature in df.columns if df[feature].isna().sum()>0 and df[feature].dtypes=='O']
print(categorical_nan)
source.545dfb79:
# replacing missing values in categorical features
for feature in categorical_nan:
    df[feature] = df[feature].fillna('None')
    

df[categorical_nan].isna().sum()
source.e01ad52d:
#Code from Gabriel Preda
#plt.style.use('dark_background')
def plot_count(feature, title, df, size=1):
    f, ax = plt.subplots(1,1, figsize=(4*size,4))
    total = float(len(df))
    g = sns.countplot(df[feature], order = df[feature].value_counts().index[:20], palette= ('coolwarm'))
    g.set_title("Number and percentage of {}".format(title))
    if(size > 2):
        plt.xticks(rotation=90, size=8)
    for p in ax.patches:
        height = p.get_height()
        ax.text(p.get_x()+p.get_width()/2.,
                height + 3,
                '{:1.2f}%'.format(100*height/total),
                ha="center") 
    plt.show()

                        y = "Gender", x= "Value", color='Gender', template='ggplot2')

fig.update_layout(title_text="Nepal Childen")

fig.show()

source.d951a9a2:
#Codes by Nayu T.S. https://www.kaggle.com/nayuts/eda-and-how-to-see-ingredient-similarity/notebook

fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(10,6), gridspec_kw=dict(wspace=0.1, hspace=0.6))
fig.suptitle("Nepal Children", fontsize=15)

g_Indicator = sns.countplot(data=df, x="Indicator", order = df['Indicator'].value_counts().index,
                       ax=axes[0])
g_Indicator.set_title("Indicator countplot")
plt.xticks(rotation=45)

g_Indicator_pie = df_Indicator.plot.pie(y="count", ax=axes[1])
g_Indicator_pie.set_title("Nepal Chidren Indicators")
source.9a70cd9e:
fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(10,6), gridspec_kw=dict(wspace=0.1, hspace=0.6))
fig.suptitle("Nepal Children", fontsize=15)

g_Belt = sns.countplot(data=df, x="Ecological Belt", ax=axes[0], 
                                 order = df['Ecological Belt'].value_counts().index)
g_Belt.set_title("Ecological Belt countplot")

df_Belt =  df[["Ecological Belt"]].copy()
df_Belt["count"] = 1
df_Belt = df_Belt.groupby("Ecological Belt").count()
g_Belt_pie = df_Belt.plot.pie(y="count", ax=axes[1])
g_Belt_pie.set_title("Ecological Belt pie plot")

fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(10,6), gridspec_kw=dict(wspace=0.1, hspace=0.6))
fig.suptitle("Nepal Children", fontsize=15)

g_Gender = sns.countplot(data=df, x="Gender", order = df['Gender'].value_counts().index, ax=axes[0])
g_Gender.set_title("Gender countplot")
plt.xticks(rotation=45)

g_Gender = sns.countplot(data=df, x="Gender", hue="Age-Group", ax=axes[1],
                         order = df['Gender'].value_counts().index)
g_Gender.legend_._loc = 1
g_Gender.set_title("Nepal Children by Age Group")
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
